results.title: Metformin Triggers Apoptosis and Induction of the G0/G1 Switch 2 Gene in Macrophages
results.text_hl: However, the anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ mechanisms of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@inflammatory macrophages@@@ are still not fully elucidated.

results.title: Metformin induces M2 polarization via AMPK/PGC-1alpha/PPAR-gamma pathway to improve peripheral nerve regeneration.
results.text_hl: In vivo, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ transformed pro-@<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@inflammatory macrophages@@@ into pro-regeneration M2 macrophages.

results.title: Metformin reduces macrophage HIF1alpha-dependent proinflammatory signaling to restore brown adipocyte function in vitro
results.text_hl: In @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ features in brown adipose tissue (BAT) such as @<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@macrophage@@@ infiltration, proinflammatory signaling and gene expression, and restored the response to cold exposure.

results.title: Therapeutic efficacies of mitochondria-targeted esculetin and metformin in the improvement of age-associated atherosclerosis via regulating AMPK activation.
results.text_hl: Administration of Mito-Esc or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ significantly reduced @DISEASE_Aging_Premature @DISEASE_MESH:D019588 @@@age@@@-induced @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerotic lesion@@@ area, @<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@macrophage@@@ polarization, @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@vascular inflammation@@@, and senescence.

results.title: Metformin Inhibits Prostate Cancer Progression by Targeting Tumor-Associated Inflammatory Infiltration.
results.text_hl: Mechanistically, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ represses @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ infiltration by downregulating both @GENE_COX2 @GENE_17709 @@@COX2@@@ and PGE2 in @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ cells.Conclusions: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is capable of repressing @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D011471 @@@prostate cancer@@@ progression by inhibiting infiltration of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@-associated @<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@macrophages@@@, especially those induced by ADT, by inhibiting the @GENE_COX2 @GENE_17709 @@@COX2@@@/PGE2 axis, suggesting that a combination of ADT with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could be a more efficient therapeutic strategy for @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D011471 @@@prostate cancer@@@ treatment.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates the progression of atherosclerosis via suppressing macrophage infiltration and inflammatory responses in rabbits.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, the aortic mRNA expression levels of adhesion molecules and inflammatory cytokines in the @GENE_MET @GENE_100126565 @@@Met@@@ group were also significantly reduced compared with those in the AS group. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment reduced monocyte adhesion to endothelial cells (ECs) and adhesion molecule expression, and inhibited @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbit@@@ monocyte differentiation into macrophages and the @<m>DISEASE_Macrophage_Activation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055501 @@@macrophage inflammatory@@@ response.
